attributes.action: Prevent Changes That Weaken the Jury System
attributes.additional_details: I oppose any Government attempt to change or reduce jury trials because this would weaken one of the most important protections in the British justice system. Jury trials ensure ordinary people help decide guilt or innocence, preventing the state from holding unchecked power. Any reform that limits jury involvement—whether for lower-level offences or otherwise—risks shifting power from the public to the Government and reducing fairness and accountability.
attributes.background: I am calling on the Government to publicly commit to preserving full jury trials and to reject any reform that reduces or restricts the right to be judged by a jury of one’s peers. The justice system must remain fair, independent, and accountable to the public.
